Package org.semanticweb.rulewerk.core.model.api

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AbstractConstant
    Interface for abstract constants, i.e.
    Conjunction<T extends Literal>
    Interface for representing conjunctions of Literals, i.e., lists of (negated or positive) atomic formulas that are connected with logical AND.
    Constant
    Interface for constants, i.e.
    DataSource
    Interfaces various types of data sources for storing facts.
    DataSourceDeclaration
    A declaration for an external data source, which assigns a predicate to a source.
    DatatypeConstant
    Interface for datatype constants, i.e.
    Entity
    Most general type of syntactic entity in Rulewerk.
    ExistentialVariable
    Interface for existentially quantified variables, i.e., variables that appear in the scope of an (implicit) existential quantifier in a rule.
    Fact
    A fact is a positive (non-negated) literal that contains only constants as its terms, but no variables.
    LanguageStringConstant
    Interface for string constants with a language tag, used to represent values of type http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString in RDF, OWL, and related languages used with knowledge graphs.
    Literal
    Interface for literals.
    NamedNull
    Interface for TermType.NAMED_NULL terms.
    NegativeLiteral  
    PositiveLiteral  
    Predicate
    A Predicate represents a relation between terms.
    PrefixDeclarationRegistry
    Registry that manages prefixes and base namespace declarations as used for parsing and serialising inputs.
    QueryResult
    A Query Result represents a list of terms that match the terms of the asked query.
    Rule
    Interface for classes representing a rule.
    Statement
    A statement is any element that a knowledge base can consist of, such as a Rule, Fact, or DataSourceDeclaration.
    StatementVisitor<T>
    A visitor for the various types of Statements in the data model.
    SyntaxObject
    General interface for all classes that represent syntactic objects that might contain atomic terms, in particular all kinds of logical formulas.
    Term
    Interface for terms.
    TermVisitor<T>
    A visitor for the various types of Terms in the data model.
    UniversalVariable
    Interface for universally quantified variables, i.e., variables that appear in the scope of an (implicit) universal quantifier in a rule.
    Variable
    Interface for variables, i.e., terms of type TermType.UNIVERSAL_VARIABLE and TermType.EXISTENTIAL_VARIABLE.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Argument
    A tagged union representing the possible types allowed to appear as arguments in commands and parser directives.
    Command
    Class for representing a generic command that can be executed.
    Terms
    Collection of utility methods for handling Terms.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    TermType
    Enumeration listing the different types of terms.
